Generation III.Ruby: Wailmer 's nostrils are located above its eyes. This playful Pok é mon loves to startle people by forcefully snorting out seawater it stores inside its body out of its nostrils.
Generation III.Sapphire: Wailmer can store water inside its body to transform itself into a ball for bouncing around on the ground. By filling itself up with more water, this Pok é mon can elevate the height of its bounces.
Generation III.Emerald: While this Pok é mon usually lives in the sea, it can survive on land, although not too long. It loses vitality if its body becomes dried out.
Generation III.FireRed: When it sucks in a large volume of seawater, it becomes like a big, bouncy ball. It eats a ton of food daily.
Generation III.LeafGreen: When it sucks in a large volume of seawater, it becomes like a big, bouncy ball. It eats a ton of food daily.

Generation IV.Diamond: On sunny days, it lands on beaches to bounce like a ball and play. It spouts water from its nose.
Generation IV.Pearl: On sunny days, it lands on beaches to bounce like a ball and play. It spouts water from its nose.
Generation IV.Platinum: On sunny days, it lands on beaches to bounce like a ball and play. It spouts water from its nose.
Generation IV.HeartGold: It bounces playfully like a ball. The more seawater it swallows, the higher it bounces.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: It bounces playfully like a ball. The more seawater it swallows, the higher it bounces.

Generation V.Black: On sunny days, it lands on beaches to bounce like a ball and play. It spouts water from its nose.
Generation V.White: On sunny days, it lands on beaches to bounce like a ball and play. It spouts water from its nose.
Generation V.Black 2: It eats one ton of food every day. It plays by shooting stored seawater out its blowholes with great force.
Generation V.White 2: It eats one ton of food every day. It plays by shooting stored seawater out its blowholes with great force.

Generation VI.X: It bounces playfully like a ball. The more seawater it swallows, the higher it bounces.
Generation VI.Y: It eats one ton of food every day. It plays by shooting stored seawater out its blowholes with great force.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Wailmer's nostrils are located above its eyes. This playful Pokémon loves to startle people by forcefully snorting out seawater it stores inside its body out of its nostrils.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Wailmer can store water inside its body to transform itself into a ball for bouncing around on the ground. By filling itself up with more water, this Pokémon can elevate the height of its bounces.

Generation VII.Sun: It loves to startle people. It fills itself up with seawater and plays by bouncing around like a ball.
Generation VII.Moon: It shows off by spraying jets of seawater from the nostrils above its eyes. It eats a solid ton of Wishiwashi every day.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: It swims along with its mouth open and swallows down seawater along with its food. It sprays excess water out of its nostrils.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Due to their memories of when they once lived on land, pods of them will, very rarely, wash up on shore.

Generation VIII.Sword: It shows off by spraying jets of seawater from the nostrils above its eyes. It eats a solid ton of Wishiwashi every day.
Generation VIII.Shield: When it sucks in a large volume of seawater, it becomes like a big, bouncy ball. It eats a ton of food daily.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: On sunny days, it lands on beaches to bounce like a ball and play. It spouts water from its nostrils.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: On sunny days, it lands on beaches to bounce like a ball and play. It spouts water from its nostrils.
